org.to2mbn.jmccc.option

Class LaunchOption

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.to2mbn.jmccc.option.LaunchOption
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class LaunchOption
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Notes for serialization:
    Make sure the authenticator implements Serializable, otherwise, an error will occur during serialization.
    Author:
    yushijinhun
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getMaxMemory

        public int getMaxMemory()
        Gets the max memory(MB), default to 1024.

        If maxMemory == 0, the max memory option won't be specified.

        Returns:
        the max memory(MB)

      • setMaxMemory

        public void setMaxMemory(int maxMemory)
        Sets the max memory(MB).

        If maxMemory == 0, the max memory option won't be specified.

        Parameters:
        maxMemory - the max memory(MB) to set
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if maxMemory<0

      • getGameDirectory

        public MinecraftDirectory getGameDirectory()
        Gets the game working directory.

        The game_directory and the subprocess working directory will be set to this.
        By default, the game directory and the minecraft directory are the same. The minecraft directory contains libraries, versions, assets, and so on. The game directory contains saves, resourcepacks, screenshots, and so on.

        Returns:
        the game directory

      • setGameDirectory

        public void setGameDirectory(MinecraftDirectory gameDirectory)
        Sets the game working directory.

        If you want to launch different minecraft versions in their own directories, use this.

        Parameters:
        gameDirectory - the game directory
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - gameDirectory=null
        See Also:
        getGameDirectory()
